ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write five types of essays in a concise and engaging way! I also learned what aspects of writing captivate and disengage readers.
I learned how to write essays that don't follow the typical 5 paragraph school essay.
I learned a lot of my weaknesses as a writer and looked for improvement. We discussed ways that other writers were able to dramatize their writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Engaging content, helpful feedback, great class environment, diverse content, helpful format (draft then final)
Weaknesses: I genuinely can not think of any weaknesses.
In most of the topics there was a reading that could help give ideas for how to write yours.

The course could work more on general essay structuring and specific tools we could use in our writing. Often, I felt like I was told the issues with my writing but didnt know how to fix them. I had to go to a writing tutor after I got feedback for every essay and still felt like I didnt know how to improve. Sometimes, the readings were way too long to be examples for how to structure our 1500 word essays. Classes would often go off on tangents. The readings should also be posted earlier, sometimes not even there until the night before. All of class would be spent talking about the readings. I think it would help the course if he broke them down more closely and talked about the literary elements on the board in a more general sense.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES, I would definitely recommend this course to another student. This course is why I am majoring in English. I entered class each day excited to analysis the texts with my classmates. The class' content is relatable and engaging, as well as beautifully written and helpful when writing different essays throughout the course. I also really liked the format of the class. I found myself looking forward to receiving my draft and discussing feedback with my professor.
Yes if you need a writing credit and don't want to write research papers.
No. I m not sure if my writing improved at all. I would only take this class if youre interested in personal writing.
